article.headline: Michigan 86, Chicago St 69
article.story: ANN ARBOR, Mich. (AP) -- Courtney Sims scored 22 points and Lester Abram added 19 to lead four Michigan players in double figures Saturday as the Wolverines held off Chicago State 86-69 in the nonconference finale for both teams. Daniel Horton scored 17 points and Dion Harris added 12 for the Wolverines (10-1), who equaled their best start since the 1989-90 season. Michigan opens its Big Ten season Tuesday at Indiana. Royce Parran scored 21 points and David Holston added 15 for the Cougars (1-11), who have played all of their games on the road. The Wolverines opened the second half by outscoring the Cougars 11-0 to take a 57-26 lead. Chicago State came back with a 20-6 run to close the gap to 63-46 with 11:31 remaining. Michigan responded with five straight points to push its lead to 22 points. Chicago State again rallied, cutting it to 76-61 with 4:26 to play. However, that was as close as the Cougars could get. After Chicago State took its only lead of the game, 5-4, Michigan went on a 15-2 run over the next 4:59, forcing four Cougar turnovers and limiting them to just two free throws. The Wolverines went on to build a 46-26 halftime advantage.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
